source_sentence: 佛說時非時經
translation: Sutra on the Hours and the Untimely

source_sentence: 天竺三藏若羅嚴譯
translation: A Translation of the Indian Tripiṭaka Waklāyan

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在王舍城鵲封竹園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at the Magpala Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 是時，佛告諸比丘：「我當為汝說：時與非時。
translation: The Buddha then addressed the monks, "I will explain this for you: 'The right time and the wrong time.'

source_sentence: 善思念之！」
translation: Consider it well!"

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「如是。
translation: The monks said, "So it is.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 當受教聽。」
translation: You will be instructed to listen."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「是中何者為時？
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "Which of these is the right time?

source_sentence: 何者為非時？
translation: What is the wrong time?

source_sentence: 比丘當知：「冬分八月十六日至三十日七脚為時，五脚半非時。
translation: Monks, you should know this, "From the 16th to the 30th day of the eighth month of the winter equinox, seven feet is the time, and five and a half feet is not the time.

source_sentence: 九月一日至十五日八脚為時，六脚八指為非時。
translation: From the first day of September to the fifteenth day of the eighth foot, it's not the time for six feet and eight fingers.

source_sentence: 九月十六日至三十日九脚為時，七脚六指為非時。
translation: When nine feet are present from the 16th to the 30th of September, seven feet and six fingers are out of season.

source_sentence: 十月一日至十五日十脚為時，八脚三指為非時。
translation: When it's ten feet from 1 to 15 October, eight feet and three fingers are out of time.

source_sentence: 十月十六日至三十日十一脚為時，九脚三指為非時。
translation: From October 16 to 30, when eleven feet are visible, nine feet and three fingers are not.

source_sentence: 十一月一日至十五日十二脚為時，十脚六指為非時。
translation: When the period from November 1 to 15 is twelve feet, the time for ten feet and six fingers is not right.

source_sentence: 十一月十六日至三十日十一脚半為時，十脚一指為非時。
translation: When it's eleven and a half feet from November 16 to 30, it's bad timing for ten feet and one finger.

source_sentence: 十二月一日至十五日十一脚為時，九脚四指為非時。
translation: When it's 11 feet from 1 to 15 December, nine feet and four fingers are out of season.

source_sentence: 「春分十二月十六日至三十日十脚為時，八脚少一指為非時。
translation: "When the vernal equinox lasts from the 16th to the 30th of December, ten feet is the time, and eight feet and one finger less is not the time.

source_sentence: 正月一日至十五日九脚半為時，七脚少三指為非時。
translation: From the first day of the first month to the fifteenth day of the ninth month, it's nine and a half feet at that time, and seven feet short of three fingers is not the time.

source_sentence: 正月十六日至三十日九脚為時，六脚少三指為非時。
translation: From the 16th day of the first month to the 30th day of the ninth month, it's bad timing to have six feet and three fingers missing.

source_sentence: 二月一日至十五日八脚為時，五脚為非時。
translation: From the first day of February to the fifteenth day of February, eight feet are considered timely, and five feet are considered not timely.

source_sentence: 二月十六日至三十日七脚為時，四脚少三指為非時。
translation: When it's seven feet from the 16th to 30th of February, it's a bad time to have four feet and less than three fingers.

source_sentence: 三月一日至十五日六脚為時，三脚少四指為非時。
translation: From the first to the fifteenth day of March, when six feet are present, it's bad timing to have three feet missing and four fingers.

source_sentence: 三月十六日至三十日五脚為時，三脚少六指為非時。
translation: When five feet are present from March 16 to 30, it's bad timing to have three feet missing six fingers.

source_sentence: 四月一日至十五日四脚為時，二脚少一指為非時。
translation: From the first day of April to the fifteenth day of April, when four feet are present, it's bad timing for two feet to have less than one finger.

source_sentence: 「夏分四月十六日至三十日三脚為時，二脚少四指為非時。
translation: "When the summer equinox lasts from April 16 to 30, a period of three feet is considered bad time, and two feet with fewer than four fingers are considered bad time.

source_sentence: 五月一日至十五日二脚為時，少三指為非時。
translation: From the first to the fifteenth day of May, when two feet are planted, a loss of three fingers is considered a bad time.

source_sentence: 五月十六日至三十日二脚半為時，一脚少為非時。
translation: It's bad time when two feet are half-half times from May 16 to 30, and one foot is missing.

source_sentence: 六月一日至十五日四脚為時，二脚少二指為非時。
translation: When four feet are present from June 1 to 15, it's considered bad timing to have two feet and less than two fingers.

source_sentence: 六月十六日至三十日四脚半為時，二脚半為非時。
translation: When it's four and a half feet from June 16 to 30, two and a half feet is considered bad timing.

source_sentence: 七月一日至十五日五脚為時，三脚少為非時。
translation: When five feet are present from July 1 through 15, a period of three feet less is considered a bad time.

source_sentence: 七月十六日至三十日五脚半為時，三脚少為非時。
translation: It's when the period from July 16 to 30 is five and a half feet long, and three feet short is considered not timely.

source_sentence: 八月一日至十五日六脚為時，四脚少為非時。
translation: When six feet are present from the first to the fifteenth day of August, four feet are few for a bad time.

source_sentence: 八月十六日至三十日六脚半為時，四脚半少為非時。
translation: When six and a half feet are from August 16 to 30, four and a half feet are not the time.

source_sentence: 「如是，諸比丘！
translation: "So it is, monks!

source_sentence: 我已說十二月時與非時。
translation: I've already explained the December time and the non-time.

source_sentence: 為諸聲聞之所應作，憐愍利益故說。
translation: I've explained what should be done for the sake of śrāvakas and for the compassionate benefit of others.

source_sentence: 我所應作已竟，汝等當行。
translation: Once you've done what I should do, you should practice.

source_sentence: 若樹下空處，露坐思惟。
translation: If there's an empty place under a tree, sit out in the open and contemplate it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 莫為放逸，後為悔恨。
translation: Don't be careless, and you'll regret it later.

source_sentence: 是我所教誡。」
translation: This is what I've instructed."

source_sentence: 佛說經竟。
translation: After the Buddha finished speaking the sūtra, the monks were all greatly encouraged to accept it.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘皆大歡喜，勸助受持：「因緣輕慢故，　　命終墮惡道，　因緣修善者，　　於此生天上，　緣斯修善業，　　離惡得解脫，　不善觀因緣，　　身壞入惡道。」
translation: The monks rejoiced greatly and encouraged their acceptance, saying, "It's because of causes and conditions that they despise that they'll fall into a bad destiny at the end of their lives; those who cultivate good causes will be born up here; depending on this cultivation of good actions, they'll be freed from evil and attain liberation; those who don't observe causes and conditions well will have their bodies destroyed and enter a bad destiny."

source_sentence: 外國法師若羅嚴，手執胡本，口自宣譯。
translation: A foreign teacher, Jorayan, held a Chinese text in his hand and translated it orally.

source_sentence: 涼州道人，于填城中寫訖。
translation: A Daoist from Liangzhou finished writing it in the city of filth.

source_sentence: 被褐懷玉，深智作愚；外如夷人，內懷明珠；千億萬劫，與道同體。
translation: He was dressed in brown and carrying jade, profoundly wise and yet foolish; outwardly, he was like a barbarian, but inside he carried a bright pearl; for a thousand billion eons, he was the same as the Way.

source_sentence: 佛說時非時經
translation: Sutra of When the Buddha Spoke Out of Time
